decision_conditions: The a/c units would, by reason of their scale, bulk, positioning and proximity to the neighbouring property no.10 Nelmes Road, be an intrusive, overbearing and unneighbourly development that would have a significant adverse effect on the amenities of these adjacent occupiers contrary to Policy 7 of the Havering Local Plan and the
Emerson Park Policy Area Supplementary Planning Document.

The proposed a/c units would, by reason of their scale, bulk, positioning and proximity to the boundary of the site and high trellis on the boundary, appear as an unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature in the streetscene harmful to the appearance of the surrounding area contrary to Policy 7 and 26 of the Havering Local Plan and the Emerson Park Policy Area Supplementary Planning Document.

Insufficient information has been provided with the current submission to judge the appropriateness of the a/c condenser units.  Whilst noise data is provided regarding the units, insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate that they will not cause a loss of amenity to the neighbouring residential premises due to noise and vibration and the proposal is therefore contrary to Havering Local Plan 2016-2031 Policies 7, 26 and 34.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, it was necessary to issue a decision as close to the statutory timeframe as possible as opposed to seeking amendments which would have significantly delayed the application.
description: Retain as existing 5no a/c condenser units to the side of the property, behind the garage. 2 units are to be moved further to the rear and a screen fence introduced to prevent visibility from the road.(Part Retrospective)
